author: Terr4
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

I am experiencing a performance issue with Invoke-Webrequest on PS 7.3.0-preview.6, compared to PS version 5.1 and 6 tested on Windows 10 and OSX.

Can be reproduced with the example URL below.
On PS 5.1 and 6 you get a return value after 1-2 seconds.
With PS 7 it takes around 70-80 seconds.

Reproducible on Windows 10 and OSX.
Please also see comparison videos.

### Expected behavior

```console
Invoke-WebRequest "https://www.libro.at/legor-30464-el-fuegos-stunt-kanone-polybag-30464-5702016668247.html" -Verbose
VERBOSE: GET https://www.libro.at/legor-30464-el-fuegos-stunt-kanone-polybag-30464-5702016668247.html
with 0-byte payload
VERBOSE: received 2586741-byte response of content type text/html

get a return value after 1-2 seconds
```


### Actual behavior

```console
Invoke-WebRequest "https://www.libro.at/legor-30464-el-fuegos-stunt-kanone-polybag-30464-5702016668247.html" -Verbose
VERBOSE: HTTP/1.1 GET with 0-byte payload
VERBOSE: received 2586741-byte response of content type text/html

get a return value after 70-80 seconds
```


### Error details

```console
Performance on PS7 is very slow compared to PS5.1 and PS6
```


### Environment data

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.3.0-preview.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.3.0-preview.6
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19044
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pNeat9bDuoQ

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qW3Bsr8ElsE

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
The issue appeared after moving to .Net 7.0.

/cc @SteveL-MSFT for information.

comments.author: NoMoreFood
comments.body: @Terr4 Is this issue consistent across common MIME types for you? I am able to reproduce this, but not when `-OutFile` is used so I'm guessing it's slowing down in the post-processing of the data.

comments.author: Terr4
comments.body:
> @Terr4 Is this issue consistent across common MIME types for you? I am able to reproduce this, but not when `-OutFile` is used so I'm guessing it's slowing down in the post-processing of the data.

I am only working with text/html responses, so unfortunately I cannot comment on other filetypes, but I also expected the postprocessing as the culprit so I tried -UseBasicParsing but without success.

I can confirm that it works very fast with -OutFile also on my side!

Just a note: The test url is not my server, so it can be that they do something to prevent such requests. However although it works very fast with versions PS5.1 and PS6

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This is quite interesting.  Trying it out I see that the progress bar indicates the content is received and then it hangs for a bit before returning the result.  Need to investigate what is happening between that time.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Looks like the problem is that URL returns a large HTML page and the cmdlet is using a regex to try and find the charset.  This takes a long time.  I'm going to see if I can find an optimization.

title: Invoke-Webrequest very slow in Powershell 7 compared to 6 and 5.1
